headline.main: FLIER SAYS HEINE BOUGHT ARMY DATA; Aerial Photographer Asserts Spy Suspect Paid for 50 Photographs of Planes

lead_paragraph: A 22-year-old aerial photographer in the Army air forces took the witness stand yesterday in an effort by the government to link Edmund Carl Heine, former foreign agent for the Ford and Chrysler Motor Companies, with a German spy ring that operated in this country until the arrest of thirty-three suspects last June.
abstract: U S Army air force photographer, H Thorell, testifies on Heine's purchase of modern plane photographs from his aircraft photo service; FBI agents testify on Duquesne's arrest and documents seized
